extendedInfo.description: Animate2D (Studio Edition)A 2D cutout animation tool for game developers and hobbyists alike.  Explore and edit the internal content or import your own cutout png's no larger than 90K in size by placing images in the /sdcard/Download folder.Features include:* Inverse Kinematics* 2D Physics Rag doll Simulation* Define Constraints on Rag Doll* Multiple IK position pin handles* IK Position Pin grouping for moving together * Graphing and Bezier Motion Smoothing Tools* Onion Skinning* Pinch Zoom* Angle transformations* Anchor transformations* Angle Pinning* Position Pinning* Rotate about node* Rotate self* Position self* Rotate self and children* Position self and children* Flip X* Flip Y* Flip Distance Node Normal* Z Order Switching* Xray mode* Frame Viewer for Navigation* Propagate Delta Forward  - to transform across frames* Propagate Delta Backward - to transform across frames* Undo Single Step* Insert Frame Forward* Insert Frame Backward* Step Forward* Step Backward* Slow Down* Speed/Up* Play/Pause* Cue to First Frame* Cue to Last Frame* Animation Collection Explorer - with copy/paste and trash can functionality* Cutout Hierarchy Editor* Copy Paste Delete range* PNG Import from /sdcard/Download provided PNGs are 90K or less in size.Checkout the blog at http://animate2d.blogspot.comThis is where questions can be asked and documentation will be updated.More features coming soon as some slated for this release did not make the cut (e.g movie generation).For game makers export format is a text file with a set of sprite transformations per frame loaded from the texture pool.  More information on the export format for game developers will be available on the blog.  C++ APIs for in game use are available using WiEngine.  More 2D engines will be supported in the future.Enjoy!tags: animation animate 2D physics animating cutout game development wiengine creative creation

reviews.title: It is so much fun
reviews.comment: If you know miku miku dance this should be a walk in the park for you its so easy  Not a lot of work to use  i mean i work with ik and boneing alot so it is very easy for me i have a talent for computer programs so it is nice to see hi tec programs for free on the google app store  Ah my computer skills entertain me once again
reviews.author: ikaik ikaika

reviews.title: Uh. . .WTF?
reviews.comment: REQUIRES PARTICIPATION IN \"SPECIAL OFFERS\" TO USE.  The first thing you\'ll see is \"account information.\"  You have to tap the butterfly to get to a screen that lists a number of special offers to sign up for that offer points to enable the use of the creative features (That is--actually creating an animation.)  The app gives you 200 points which I somehow blew through in one session before I made heads or tails out of the VERY COMPLICATED USER INTERFACE.  There is another \"Enterprise Edition\" of the software which has absolutely insane pricing.  The single highest price I\'ve ever seen on the Play Store by an order of magnitude.  I have mixed (but mostly negative) feelings about this.  I can understand that a developer\'s product needs to earn, but if this business model catches on, it will positively kill the Play Store.  (This is coming from someone who regularly pays for apps.)  The software seems to be very capable--well above any other animation software I\'ve seen on the Play Store.  And I like the developers blog.  But if I could give it a lower score I would.
reviews.author: David Contreni

reviews.author: Ian Thompson

reviews.title: Far too powerful for a phone app
reviews.comment: If you don\'t have patience to read the documentation you will not be able to use the app period (unless you are a gifted child).  This app is not for you unless you are creating animations for in game usage.  I though I\'d be able to make use of it on the subway on the way to work, but I can hardly find a seat to sit in let alone concentrate on creating some in game animations.  I do from time to time put the app in IK physics mode and fling my character around which is really cool and fun but it it made me lazy and I don\'t bother to create walk cycles, run cycles or jump cycles anymore. the free motion is far more interesting to me.  non repetitive. engaging.
reviews.author: John Coppola

reviews.comment: Wow im lovin this.  Looks great.
